pros: -Network with faculty and administration -Further understanding of the departmental curriculum -Learn the ins and outs of a higher education institution
cons: No disadvantages experienced by me

pros: Great coworkers! The whole campus does a great job at keeping Jesus at the center of what we are doing.
cons: There haven't been any cons.

job_title: Online Digital Manager in Springfield, MO
pros: Evangel is a place that allows for nurturing and communication. I had a lot of freedom in this position and was able to learn a lot on my own. I also had a chance to grow into my role comprehensively.
cons: Since this was a new role, freedom was frightening at first.

job_title: Primary College Counselor in Springfield, MO
pros: Great people to work with.
cons: Horrible money for what you do.

pros: Friendly folks to work with

pros: Pretty laid back and can be fun to work at.

pros: Supportive co-workers, relaxed atmosphere, nice campus

review_title: Stable-ish but no room for advancement
job_title: Digital Content Specialist in Springfield, MO
pros: Faith-based environment and good benefits
cons: Leadership/Supervisors. Lack of being open to advancement and innovation.

pros: Evangel is a wonderful place to work and has a friendly yet professional atmosphere. There are opportunities for advancement and management goes out of their way to treat people with respect and show them that they are valued. I worked in the admissions department with adult students, and I never felt overworked.
cons: Health premiums are expensive and the pay is average for the area. Salary was not negotiable at all in admissions. All adult students and staff are required to sign a lifestyle agreement stating they will not use tobacco products or drink any alcohol at all. This even applies to adult students who only take online classes. Also the application asks very personal questions that go into a student's permanent file.

pros: Evangel University is an organization that truly cares about the people they hire, and the students they serve. Working for them for a short time while being a student here has been a wonderful experience. They care about your success, and will only place you in a position if they feel you will thrive in it. I would recommend working or studying here to anyone who is interested!
cons: This is a pro and a con in different ways... your personal life is closely monitored. Being a Christian organization, there are standards you must met to be employed. The accountability is great, but there is also strict policies and occasional lack of privacy.

job_title: Student Admissions Counselor in Springfield, MO
pros: Great coworker relations, great incentives, and Christian environment make it enjoyable. Continuously seeking improvement in the system.
cons: Monotonous work - calling people for a few hours straight. Continuous shift in leadership creates less productive and slightly frustrating environment, but most in leadership are doing all they can to catch up. Training was minimal.

pros: Really enjoyed the new direction of the university with the new president, Dr. Taylor.  Evangel also has a great sense of community among the faculty, staff, and students.  They do an employer match for retirement contributions.
cons: As a small non-profit, Evangel struggles to pay salaries comparable to the local economy, but is improving in this arena.

pros: You have a flexible schedule. You can take time off as you need it. The professors are quite understanding.
cons: You get paid very, very little for the quality of work that you perform. Students can often be very rude and disrespectful.

job_title: Former Office Assistant in Springfield, MO
pros: Worked in the Behavioral Sciences office and my supervisors were the best! They really care about you and the work environment was friendly and engaging.
cons: Was an international student and therefore was only allowed to legally work on campus. By law international students can work more hours in the summer but administration only allowed less thn what was legally allowed.

review_title: Great Place to Work For, Very Rewarding, Excellent Management and Department Directors
job_title: Public Safety Officer & Dispatcher in Springfield, MO
pros: Great group of people, everyone on campus is extremely nice and make the job better, Christian environment, high level of respect and professionalism.
cons: Nothing, I honestly never had a bad day of work while I was there.

pros: Good people. Nice work environment. Flexible hours. Job was not very repetitive and offered variation in work.
cons: Most of the challenges or issues I had here were linked to kind of low pay and not a ton of opportunity for advancement.

pros: Good benefits and time off policies, and amazingly high Christian values.
cons: The only issues that arise are those that happen in any organization run by human beings, as a result of all of our imperfections.
